etymologies: late 18th century. From scientific Latin Termes, genus name (LinnaeusSystema naturae (ed. 10, 1758) 609) from post-classical Latin termes (plural termites) woodworm, maggot, variant (probably influenced by terere: see below) of classical Latin tarmes from the base of terere to rub + the base of -mus, suffix forming nouns and adjectives

definitions: An insect of the genus Termes, which originally included all termites but is now restricted to a small number of tropical species; (in form Termes) the genus itself.

notes.text: Instances of the regular plural termites are not clearly distinct from the plural of "termite", and are treated at that entry.
